intro: Gilia oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
